About Me

My name is Alex Chea, and I am a versatile Boston-based professional with experience in software engineering, data analysis, UX consulting, and product/project management. My passion for computer science stems from its unique combination of logic, problem-solving, and creative thinking.

With a Master's degree in Computer Science, specializing in Data Science, Machine Learning, and Human-Centered AI, I’ve developed skills in building scalable data pipelines, automating processes, and designing interactive solutions that enhance user experiences.

Outside the academic and professional world, I find joy in cooking and baking – both are incredibly therapeutic for me. My passion for exploration extends to travel; I lived in Laos for four years before migrating to the United States.

As for why my GitHub username is "icodealittle" – there’s no grand explanation. I simply thought it was a fun and lighthearted way to describe myself as I navigate this exciting and ever-evolving industry.

Programming Languages: Python, TypeScript, Java, R, C, C++

Web Technologies: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, GSAP (GreenSock), Webpack, Node.js, React.js, Angular

Data Tools & Libraries: SQL, MongoDB, MySQL, Firebase, BigQuery, Tableau, Power BI

Machine Learning Libraries: TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, HuggingFace, spaCy, NLTK

Frameworks: Docker, Kubernetes, RESTful APIs, GraphQL

Collaboration Tools: Jira, Confluence, Notion, Slack

Version Control & Hosting: Git, GitHub, Hostinger

Other Skills: Agile Methodologies, Data Visualization, UX Research, Automation with Selenium & Playwright
